main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified objects were reported in Gulfport, Mississippi on December 6, 1954, with descriptions of round, flat gray objects maneuvering in the sky.
interesting points: The sightings included a bright sound light observed at 200-600 feet, which hovered and then disappeared., A round, flat gray object appeared to hover and rotate at high RPM, estimated speed of 500-600 MPH., Witnesses described seeing a round silhouette object that maneuvered erratically for about 20 minutes., Colonel George A. Elliott also witnessed a bright object moving rapidly across the sky for approximately 10 minutes., Some eyewitnesses suggested the sightings could be attributed to natural phenomena such as a small vortex of wind and dust.
witness description: Civilian observers including Mr. Robert Tschuma and Colonel George A. Elliott
